findings.title: Negative values in payout may cause token buyers to pay more than the listing price
findings.description: A malicious seller could update the list by using a negative value in the payout to marketplace fee or royalties which makes listing price lower and attractive to the potential buyer. However, the onchain contract uses absolute values and the negative value would be treated as positive value.

findings.title: The buyer of a listed token may not receive the token.
findings.description: A malicious seller can update the payout of the sell eUTXO by adding a payout which sends the listed token to an address controlled by the seller, without using the jpg.store webpage. The buyer of the listed token may not receive the listed token if he/she does not carefully check the buy transaction details when signing the transaction.

findings.title: The seller may not get the fair amount of Ada for the sell
findings.description: A malicious offerer can modify an offer without using the Jpg.Store Dapp, adjusting the amount of Ada paid to royalties and marketplace fee, resulting in the owner receiving less Ada than the offered price.

findings.title: Fake token attacks
findings.description: Token related issues where fake tokens can be used to manipulate the system.

findings.title: Unsound minting policies
findings.description: Token related issue where unsound minting policies can lead to security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Side minting attacks
findings.description: Unsound minting policies allowing side minting attacks.

findings.title: Token uniqueness attacks
findings.description: The NFT minting policy shall ensure that the NFT is unique.

findings.title: Contract clone attacks
findings.description: Attack surface considered for token related issues

findings.title: Deadly transaction repetition
findings.severity: P1: Highest priority; loss of funds, deadlock of funds, hijack of protocol, arbitrary minting of tokens, etc.
